meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The jello was very liquidy and wiggly on the plate.
meanings.sent2: The watercolor paint had a liquidy texture as it spread on the paper.
meanings.sent3: The liquidy soap slipped out of his hands and onto the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a liquidy quality, flowing smoothly through the room.
meanings.sent5: The liquidy lava oozed slowly down the side of the volcano.

meanings.definition: Having a consistency like that of a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The melted ice cream was so liquidy, it dripped down the cone.
meanings.sent2: The mud after the rain was very liquidy and hard to walk through.
meanings.sent3: The liquidy pancake batter splattered everywhere when she poured it into the pan.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were all mixed up, swirling around in a liquidy mess.
meanings.sent5: The liquidy glue slowly seeped into the crack, sealing it shut.
